thread.title: Top Places to Teach English in South America
thread.title_full: Top Places to Teach English in South America

title: Top Places to Teach English in South America
text:
(c)Rex Pe 
When it comes to a working holiday, having a qualification to teach English as a foreign language is one of the most useful certificates that you can have, and if you are looking to explore South America, it certainly offers up a good range of opportunities. 
South America will offer both paid places, where you will be expected to work for a reasonable period each week, or voluntary roles that will give you a lot more time to explore the area. The best place to teach will largely depend on what you are hoping to do during your visit and your own preferences. Santiago, Chile 
The Chilean capital is a wonderful place to live, offering easy access to the hiking and skiing destinations of the Andes by traveling east, and the coast by traveling west. The city is vibrant and interesting with a wonderful culture and plenty of bars and restaurants where you can socialize with the locals and other teachers. 
The Chilean system is currently supporting the teaching of English, and there are many roles available from high schools and universities out to the specialized language institutes. Cali, Colombia 
A vibrant city that is famous for its passion and its love of Salsa, teaching here will almost inevitably also include learning how to dance and then trying your moves in the city's dance clubs. Many of the roles that are available in Cali involve working at a Private International School, which will usually offer accommodation and a reasonable salary, which is a great introduction to Colombian life, but will usually need some teaching experience. Smaller schools will still offer roles to those without significant experience, but these roles usually have a smaller salary. La Paz, Bolivia 
Living at altitude is something that will take people quite a while to adapt to, but surrounded by some of the high mountains of the Andes, this is certainly one of the most scenic places to teach English. The colonial architecture is still attractive, although it is decaying without adequate maintenance, but with the traditional indigenous culture still strong this is a fascinating place to teach. 
Salaries are not huge compared to international standards, but with living costs much lower this is still an interesting proposition,   many volunteer roles that are unpaid but do offer accommodation. Fortaleza, Brazil 
For those who have a proficiency in Portuguese rather than Spanish, the opportunity to teach English in Brazil is a very attractive one, and this coastal city is one of the best places for those looking to enjoy a great lifestyle. 
A great place to live with many residential areas near the beach, the night life here is good too. The best roles in Brazil usually go to teachers with over two years experience along with a degree, but there are roles for those with TEFL qualifications or the equivalent too. Georgetown, Guyana 
This interesting city on the north coast of the country is home to several Private International Schools that do have regular roles for those who can teach English as a foreign language. The salary is often competitive, with the working week usually between twenty to thirty hours per week. 
The Caribbean influences here are strong, with a great passion for cricket, and the national drink, rum, providing the lubricant for many good nights. Buenos Aires, Argentina 
This cosmopolitan capital is home to a wide range of institutions that offer jobs for those who can teach English, and while the cost of living is fairly high, the salaries are competitive and accommodation will often be included as a part of the package. 
The work can range from teaching children and young people in schools through to universities and language schools where you will be teaching adults of all ages. Our Expert Recommends
